They are refusing to investigate my issue and are just telling me it's my problem. InPost have confirmed to me that the delivery was made to the correct place. I decided to reorder as I didnt want my son in law to incur costs. I paid again for ship and tax. This company does not do exchanges, this co. does not have a phone #, this company does not combine ship, this company is atrocious. I will never do business with Nike ever again. It was a costly sweatshirt and they are penny wise and dollar foolish. Must be in trouble financially due to their disgusting practices in China having the Wighurs make all their apparel. Not a company I want any further association with.

review_title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY 0 STAR

review_title: Fraud, waste of time, no orders processed, no customer service
cust_review_text: They do not process orders for "sale" items. They do not process payments, although the process runs normally via Paypal and paypal sends a confirmation for the order (not the payment!). I ve tried to place an order twice, did the whole procedure, and then everything disappears!! Their customer service is just bots not able to respond to anything! Disgusting, worse than fraudulent dodgy sites!!! NIKE SHAME ON YOU!!!!

If I could give 0/5 stars, I would.In the first week of December, I ordered two products from Nike, intending to give them as Christmas presents. The website assured me that if I ordered before 9 December (which I did), I would receive my order before Christmas. By 23 December 2024, I still hadn't received any updates—no tracking number, nothing—so I called their call centre. The agent confirmed that there was a mistake on their side and my order hadn't even been processed yet. I was also told it would only be delivered in the new year.Since they were Christmas gifts, this was unacceptable, so I opted to cancel the order and requested a refund. The agent assured me I would receive the refund within 10 working days.It’s now 24 January 2025, and I still haven’t received my refund. Nike owes me R 3,249.90. I’ve contacted their customer service five times, and every time I’m told it’s "under review" or "awaiting management approval." When I ask for updates, I hear nothing back.To make matters worse, I had to scramble to buy replacement gifts last minute on Christmas Eve at the busy shops—something I was trying to avoid by ordering online in the first place.This level of service is completely unacceptable. I expected far better from a globally recognised company like Nike. I will never buy from them again, and I wouldn’t recommend anyone else to, either.

review_title: My initial experience with Nike was one…

review_title: Horrible! Nike is an absolute joke

review_title: They want you to correct errors they make as a company
cust_review_text: Where to start ! Ordered a tracksuit that cost over £200 and have been sent the wrong jumper but the correct trousers so it doesn't match! The jumper that has been delivered is worth alot less and doesn't match.I've spoke to a nike Athlete online through my Nike app and have been advised to go to a store which is 40 mins away as they cannot send me the correct order after the error they made.Offered me 10 % voucher code please don't insult me I've spent thousands with Nike.To top it off the nike Athlete left the conversation without resolving the issue. Had no any chance to get to talk to any human in Nike. Looks like the Christmas Eve has started in Nike very early today. Not very impressed at all.

If anything, get your Nike gear from anywhere but Nike.com. Save yourself the hassle. Worse experience with Nike and will not be purchasing from their direct site anymore.

review_title: This was my first time ordering…
cust_review_text: This was my first time ordering directly from Nike. My order was dispatched the day after I placed it and was sent from Belgium to Denmark. I received it a day earlier than promised. No complaints here. 5/5 experience.

Appalling - charged me for an order that never arrived. Their customer services is an endless loop that cuts you off on the phone before speaking to someone, and even their online chatbot is always too busy to talk. Very scammy.

No update so i contacted them today and basically Nike couldn't care less they advised it will need another 3-4 working days. review_title: Ordering from Nike.com. Just DON'T do it!
cust_review_text: We ordered a pair of Nike Dunk Low Retro and Air Jordan 1 Mid sneakers from the Nike*com*za* website on 04 Dec 24. After receiving confirmation of our order via email (nike*official*nike*com) all went quiet and we received no further communication. I called the Nike helpline to enquire on the progress. I got through to an assistant who could barely communicate in English. The first assistant said the order was on its way. When I called again a few days later, I was told that the order was inactive and I would get a refund. After no further correspondence, I contacted a "Nike athlete" on the online Chat. I do not have words to describe how unprofessional the Nike athlete chats were. Some decided to post heart emojis and words like "don't worry" with a heart emoji in an extremely condescending way. It is now the 29 Dec and we have received absolutely NO updates or shipping details since the order confirmation email on the 04 Dec. We have decided to submit a chargeback complaint with the credit card company. Please read this and think VERY CAREFULLY before ordering from the Nike.com site.

Customer services are very poor, I am trying to get a replacement for a tech fleece that shrunk on first wash, that was washed according to instructions-for month! No one replies, and when they do they ask for the tongue label- it’s a hoodie! Then no reply again for weeks- fed up tbh..

review_title: I am very disappointed with the…
cust_review_text: I am very disappointed with the customer service how they handle calls how to handle refunds and how they make a customer suffer. The people who are picking up the call will not give you their names and when they talk to you, they just brush you off being defensive and do not want to help they have no notes on the system if I’ve spoken to someone why am I calling back again? I have an account with them and you expect that they put notes on the system if they’ve spoken to a customer and promised what they’re going to do next…,they will not help you but by the end of the call they’ll say is that something you would like me to help you with that’s ridiculous.. I have returned two pair of trainers worth around £300 and I’ve been told that they only received one. I did exactly what the Customer Service asked me to do and I kept posting them the evidence of my refund and my return. It’s really sad that no one knows what’s happening and they just brush you off saying we haven’t received it. Someone will promise you that your money will be given back and the other agent says no it won’t be done everyone!!  It’s been a week and I’ve been calling them and spending hours but there’s no help. Sadly Nike is a great product. The people who are working to sell them and give service have really downgraded the whole experience of Nike !!!!!!!!! 😡😡😡😡

review_title: I bought shoes from the online website…
cust_review_text: I bought shoes from the online website and returned 3 pairs on the same day with EVRI. Nike did not give my refund, claiming that I STOLE THE SHOES and sent them an EMPTY BOX. I have used EVRI and never in my life experienced such bullshit. By looking at the previous Trustpilot reviews, it is obvious that Nike is ripping off the customers, as many experienced the same problem with Nike deliveries but what's even worse is, they blamed me on the phone for stealing the shoes! That is ABSOLUTELY DISGGUSTING AND HUMILIATING. If the delivery company fails, it is Nike's responsibility not the shoppers... NEVER EVER GOING TO SHOP FROM NIKE AGAIN.I want my refund. I will make sure to complain to anywhere necessary including consumers ombudsman and make sure this is resolved.

review_title: False adverting off a money off voucher
cust_review_text: I ordered 2 sizes in the Jordan trainers as the sizing is so different to the Nike Air Force Ones and the original size I had ordered was too small and I had to return them. I had a £20 off voucher if I spent over £60 which I used in this order which totalled £149.98. I need to send one pair back and Nike have decided to split the £20 off between the 2 pairs so are only refunding me £74.99 rather than £84.99 so that the pair I am keeping would benefit from the £20 off. If I had placed an order for 1 pair this is what I would have paid. I have spent over 1 1/2 hours online chat trying to get this resolved but they will not honour the £20 off voucher.

I placed a gift order with nike.com. Six days later my credit card was cancelled due to fraudulent activity. My card had not yet been charged for the nike.com order and the order had not yet shipped. I tried to change the payment method with customer service, but they said that's impossible after 30 minutes after ordering. They offered to cancel my order and create a new order with the new credit card. I was happy until I discovered they had shipped and charged both the "cancelled" order and the replacement. When I called support service a second time, they said it's impossible to cancel orders after 30 minutes after ordering, in direct opposition to what I had been told previously by customer service. Beware. If you order from nike.com, your order cannot be altered in any way or cancelled after 30 minutes, even if, like me, it takes 13 days to ship.

Tried contacting them regarding an order. Found out they have no customer service available in Canada. Chat messages and phone calls go unanswered despite multiple attempts over several days. Ridiculous.

For the 2nd time when I have paid for home delivery they decided that it is acceptable to request DPD service to deliver to a collection point rather than my home address. This is not *home delivery*.  This is a *collection* service and is not acceptable. Won't be ordering from Nike again.
The fact that no-one even bothers to respond to all the negative reviews on here says it all. A once great company now has the worst customer service I have ever experienced

review_title: I never leave reviews but £124 stolen by Nike ...
cust_review_text: I never leave reviews but Nike has the worst CS i have ever experienced. I had a voucher worth £124, and tried to place an order, the order failed to place successfully but Nike kept the voucher value as used leaving me with 1p on the voucher. They admitted that the item I was trying to buy was throwing a site error, and accepted that the voucher had now been marked as redeemed on their website, and they can clearly see no order was assigned or successfully placed at the point of 'voucher use'. So the conclusion of course is that due to technical error they have 'mistakenly' kept the voucher value. Logical solution would be to reimburse me in some way. But no, their specialist team says the voucher use was against policy and cannot be reimbursed. Ridiculous, the voucher supplier had already contacted their Nike contact point who already said it's on the specialist team to resolve and reimburse it. They did not resolve it. They decided to keep the money. All their 'NikeAthlete' CS team system does also is promote anonymity and reduce accountable to resolving cases properly. Never agian.

I ordered a shoe at 9 am and received a email at 6pm saying it was canceled. Could not reorder because it was sold out. They even put a hold on the money. This is unprofessional because it should have never let me order if they could not provided the item. This was a gift for someone.

I used to be a loyal Nike trainer wearer, but I've noticed a significant decline in their quality and design since around 2020. The trainers now have a noticeably narrower fit, which makes them uncomfortable and unsuitable for many people. Additionally, the quality of the materials has deteriorated.One glaring issue is the colorful plastic used on the outer soles. While it might look appealing, it’s clearly a cost-cutting measure. This material does not provide good grip on the ground and becomes dangerously slippery on wet surfaces. I don’t believe it meets essential health and safety standards.I believe these changes—such as the narrower fit and the use of subpar materials—pose potential risks, especially for younger generations. This could lead to long-term harm to their feet. For my part, I’ve stopped wearing Nike trainers to prioritize my foot health. However, I feel compelled to share my experience to raise awareness about these concerning issues.

review_title: Your site is an absolute joke

review_title: I have been a loyal customer to Nike…
cust_review_text: I have been a loyal customer to Nike for many years. Decades. I've ordered online before, without a problem. But in the big year of 2024 the service is shocking. I waited and contacted for advice. The order was then cancelled and reordered, with a promise that it will be delivered in 4 business days. The items are still not trackable and the customer service team in unavailable due to high demand. This is the biggest commercial sports brand!!!! Never had issues ordering an Amazon like this. And 8 days to get a refund if you can get hold of customer service is a joke!!

I spoke with the customer service, told me to send a photo of the product and the label with the size, and arranged a free return again with Ups back to Germany and the correct size to be delivered again. Another 5 working days to arrive there, and another 5 to send the correct supposedly!! And surprise they sent me exactly the same pair of shoes (because I noticed that it had a little default), the wrong size!!!! I am asking for a refund and sending it back!!! What a ridiculous company you are Nike!! They gave me 2 discount codes for the site, but I told them I don't need them as I 'm not ordering EVER AGAIN!! Not even 1 star

Lamentable engañan a la gente como quieren, se inventan una plataforma como SNKRS para ver sus productos y los que van a sacar, y resulta que solo puedes comprar los que nadie quiere, porque los productos más importantes los ponen a la venta tipo como un sorteo que nunca toca, es como la lotería, para luego ese mismo producto venderlo 5 veces más caro en otras mismas plataformas crea por ellos mismos y sus socios como GOAT o STOCKX. Nos engañan como a marionetas y muñecos. Lo mejor, vayan a las tiendas como se ha hecho toda la vida y compren allí, porque en estas aplicaciones lo único que van a hacer es engañarle como ellos quieren y  a su manera.It's a shame that they deceive people however they want. They invent a platform like SNKRS to see their products and the ones they're going to release, and it turns out that you can only buy the ones that nobody wants, because the most important products are put up for sale like a raffle that never comes up, it's like the lottery, and then they sell that same product for 5 times more on other platforms created by themselves and their partners like GOAT or STOCKX. They deceive us like puppets and dolls. The best thing is to go to the stores as it has always been done and buy there, because in these applications the only thing they are going to do is deceive you however they want and in their own way.

review_title: NIKE will not honor their warranty!
cust_review_text: I purchased a pair of Nike Flex Trainers to play handball. They fit great and were quite suitable to the rigors of the game. After about one month, the shoes started to make a disastrous squeaking noise whenever i would wear them. It was annoying to me and distracting to anyone else on the court with me. I tried replacing the inserts, using talcum powder inside the shoe, but could not stop the squeak. Totally disgusted, I purchased another pair of the same model of shoes, (incorrectly) assuming that this problem was merely with this pair. Having never had this happen with any shoes, what could be wrong? Within about 6 weeks of 3x week wear, they too began to squeak. It sounded exactly like the other pair (sitting in my closet). So I contacted Nike and explained what was going on. They said to mail the shoes in and they would evaluate the defect to determine if it was a material or manufacturing defect. Two weeks go by and I receive a form letter indicating that their evaluation of the shoe has determined that it is not a material or manufacturing defect. I contacted their customer service "athletes" by phone, which appeared to be in other countries than ours, who said they could do nothing for me and that I should "APPEAL" their decision by replying to the denial letter they sent. I sent my reply, indicating that it wasn't just one pair BUT TWO OF THE SAME MODEL OF SHOE doing the same thing. I received the next denial letter, indicating that their senior quality control staff had reviewed and their findings also denied the materials and workmanship were faulty. So, now, I'm sitting with two pairs of comfortable SQUEAKY shoes that set me back close to $200 that I cannot wear. I went on-line and looked up that model of Nike shoe. It seems that over 1/3 of the people who purchased them have had the same problem with the squeaking. Those that didn't appear to be people who wore them for walking and nothing active. I am done with Nike products. They are supposed to be a company with a solid reputation. This is a poor reflection on their company. It wasn't a one-time issue. It appears to be a recurring problem they refuse to address.

I am deeply disappointed with my experience dealing with Nike’s customer service regarding a returned package. Here’s a summary of what happened:I returned a package to Nike around late October, expecting a straightforward refund process. Instead, I was left waiting with no updates or communication from them. After raising my first inquiry in late November, I received no meaningful follow-up or resolution. A second attempt to contact customer service in early December finally prompted a response — but only to tell me to deal directly with Evri, the courier service.Evri, however, clarified that Nike, as the account holder for the return, must escalate any claims. This means I had no way to resolve the issue myself. When I relayed this information to Nike’s customer service, they dismissed it, saying the case was closed and nothing more could be done.This experience has been beyond frustrating. The lack of accountability and the refusal to address the issue despite clear evidence from Evri reflects poorly on Nike as a brand. Their customer service has shown no urgency, transparency, or willingness to help. I’ve been left without a refund and no resolution in sight.I cannot recommend Nike based on this experience. They need to seriously rethink how they handle customer complaints and returns.

I said I was still waiting on the refund for the item which was out of stock. I was told that I should ring my bank!! I am really hoping I get the full refund but am not confident. I have not got an email confirming the cancellation and refund, but have got an email with a 25% voucher as I bought my items on Black Friday.  I told the sales advisor I would not be ordering online with them again and could I use the voucher in a Nike store, the answer was no.  This is the worst online shopping experience I have had. So surprised for a company this size.

I’ve ordered 11 pairs of shoes and countless clothing items just this year alone from Nike.com. I’ve spent almost $4k this year on their site. Every order I’ve ever placed with them has been delivered through UPS and I’ve had no issues up until now. For some reason they used OnTrac to ship my items this time and it’s been a total nightmare! Upon checking my tracking number it showed delivered. I was home so I went out front and to my surprise, no package! I checked Ontracks tracking info again and realized that the driver posted a picture. Problem is, it was a picture of my package in front of someone else’s house. I immediately got in touch with Nike and they told me I would have to file a claim with OnTrac. I call Ontrack, spoke to 2 different reps and they both told me only the seller (Nike) can make a claim. So, I call Nike again, wait over an hour to speak to someone, and they basically tell me sorry, nothing we can do. So now after spending $4k with this company this year, never once having an issue, they basically tell me I’m screwed! I’m out $180 for shoes I never received. Well Nike, I can assure you that you will NEVER get another dollar out of me for as long as I live. Congratulations you lost a life long customer today.

Recently ordered some trainers in the black Friday sale with a 25% off discount code. Trainers were due for delivery a week later and after checking order tracking page the courier listed it as "Exception" and that it is being sent back to Nike?? confused to say the least, I contacted Nike via the web chat. They advised that unfortunately nobody was able to collect from their courier depot, so it’s been sent back to Nike... THIS IS A HUGE NATIONAL COMPANY! the web chat advisor immediately processed a refund as I was told it wasn’t possible to send the trainers out again. I was then offered a 15% discount code to re-order but that they wouldn’t honour the black Friday discount code as it had expired. So, I was down money while I waited for my refund, I had no product and then expected to pay more than my original price not to mention the inconvenience it has caused. I then called Nike to talk to an operator who advised me that I was told the wrong information and that they could honour the discount code however I'd be expected to pay for the trainer’s full price to then be refunded the difference after? So not only do I not have my product on time, but I’m also waiting 8 working days for my original refund, I’m expected to pay the full price to then wait another 8 working days to be refunded the difference and having to wait over 2 weeks for my product. The operator didn’t listen and advised me it wasn’t within Nike's policy. Although bother operatives were friendly and apologetic on behalf of Nike I find it hard to believe this was the only solution. Terrible customer experience and unfortunately not the first bad experience with Nike.

review_title: Do not use courier to return an item
cust_review_text: First Time Buying experience with Nike online, delivery was quick, but had to return 1st order, as size was small. Filled online returns form and chose drop off at In Post drop off location, received email  from courier confirming return delivered to Nike. Waited 2 weeks didn't hear anything from Nike, so rang customer services on Monday and after waiting 45 min finally got to speak to someone abroad, As requested forwarded the email from courier to Nike confirming return delivered to them, was than advised to wait few days while they look into it, no response from Nike, rang back again on Friday same week, another 30 min wait, got through to someone abroad, same process send us courier confirmation, re sent again, than another 30min later of going backwards/forwards, nike responded we have investigated our end and we have not received your return. I than politely requested a manager call back, as they were unable to do anything more, this call back they promised amd was suppose to be done within 24HRS. But it didn't happen until following Monday, while i was waiting for this call back i rang the courier In Post and they confirmed no one from Nike has been in touch to investigate this return, the courier than confirmed via email they had returned the parcel back to Nike. Out of desperation i tried their online chat service, after 45 min athlete joined the chat who just kept on giving robotic answers and wast really unhelpful, apparently the issue has now been passed to Senior Team to look into, but wouldn't say anything more than that. Monday came and received a call from a number in Netherlands, which was a manager from Nike who promised to look into the matter and respond within 7-8 days. Nike have now confirmed they have received my return which they previously said they did not, but the items returned items were not the shoes i had ordered.UPDATE!I have changed my rating from 1 to 5, fault wasnt Nikes, Nike has fully refunded me. Today i have received my original parcel back from In post (courier)with fleece blanket, so either Driver or warehouse staff has nicked 2 brand new trainers from the box, put a fleece blanket inside it and sent it to nike, I have rung nike to explain and to pass the message to their manager.

review_title: I had a really bad experience with the South African online store
cust_review_text: I had a really bad experience with the South African online shop. I ordered goods to be delivered to an address in South Africa. The system requested that I give them an ID number, but it wouldn't accept other ID numbers such as passports etc. I reached out to the online help desk only to be told that they strictly required an SA ID. What happens to tourists? Or those wanting to purchase a gift for someone in that country? Someone really needs to look at this system because it's not friendly at all. Not everybody has the time to visit a store, or has that specific ID. I would assume that if one has a valid ID that should suffice, wherever it has been issued. Sometimes you just want to purchase something and have it delivered to your hotel etc. The online agent didnt even want to assist by providing me with an alternative way to submit the required ID. Order was automatically cancelled in the system for ''non - compliance''. It's really unfortunate.

review_title: Would give no stars if I could
cust_review_text: Would give no stars if I could. My teenage son was successful in the “drop” of some limited edition Travis Scott trainers and we paid the inflated price. The wrong, completely different trainers were delivered so we got straight on to Customer Services. The guy didn’t have a great command of English unfortunately so it was a difficult conversation. He assured me we would get the correct item when the others were returned, which we did straight away. Fast forward a few days and still no correct trainers. My son rang customer services who told him they had issued a refund. I went in the chat bot and had a very long but unfruitful chat with someone who also didn’t fully grasp what I was saying and just said there was nothing they could do and twice ignored my request to be put on to a manager. Also was told there was no address or email to write to and you can’t find one on line either. review_title: I raised a complaint with Nike…
cust_review_text: I raised a complaint on the Nike Chat that I would like to raise a complaint that a manager is unable to call or speak to me after me ringing 3 times today. First time, I was told someone would call me straight back and didn’t. Second time, someone would call within 2 hrs - and didn’t. Third time, someone said within 24hrs but has my request logged as urgent. I ordered Nike pro leggings and the ones I have received are infant ones, proof been sent and accepted. The problem of what I am highly disappointed in - my mum is extremely poorly and therefore as a family we are having Xmas early this year (Sunday) so my mum can give all her grandchildren Xmas presents early.I have requested that another pair that is correct size be sent (as this is not my fault) asap so as not to miss out on a present on Sunday as this will be the last present her Nana will ever give her. These are unprecedented times and I am so upset of how Nike have dealt with this and just fobbed it off with the words “our procedure is…”. Unfortunately time is not on our side and this CANNOT wait as my mum may not even make next week. I have offered to send medical evidence as this isn’t something I am making up - however - if Nike had sent the correct item, I wouldn’t have had to make 3 separate phone calls and now a message to get someone to listen to me! This is really unacceptable. I then proceeded to try through the Nike Chat and after discussing all the above... ended up saying, nothing we can do and ended the chat. SHOCKING!!!

That is not the way to deal with problems. Be polite, be courteous and be patient.Fantastic service and I can't thank nike enough for putting my fears to rest.... Absolutely made up with this service and the trainers 👌Update 28/11/24Received Jordan bottoms today. App never worked for me so used Google to enter nike site. Goods delivered by royal mail and sent post office cause I may not of been home. Great first time experience and quality what I expected from Nike.... Always been my favorite trainers and tracksuits

Nike once stood for greatness—exceptional designs, the latest in footwear technology, and unparalleled quality. But those days are gone. How many men would be happy wearing unisex clothes...not many.. why do teen boys have to wear unisex clothes??. I had cash to spend but after trying to differentiate the sexes. We gave up and bought what we needed in the Puma store. I get you are pro trans and thats fine but have some common sense and have some respect for your customers time. review_title: I am incredibly frustrated with my overall experience
cust_review_text: I am incredibly frustrated with my recent experience ordering from Nike. My order was supposed to arrive in one to three days, but it’s now overdue, and I’m still waiting. I’ve reached out to both Nike’s customer service and their delivery provider multiple times, only to be bounced back and forth with no real answers or help.Nike’s customer service has been little help—they keep telling me to check with the delivery company, but when I contact them, I’m met with vague, inconsistent information and no clear update on when my package will actually arrive. It feels like neither Nike nor the delivery company is taking any responsibility, and the lack of communication has been exhausting.For a brand as big as Nike, this is extremely disappointing. I expected better service, especially given the high standards they promote. I’m seriously considering canceling my order because I can’t rely on either the delivery company or Nike’s support. This has been an incredibly frustrating experience, and I won’t be ordering from them again if this is the level of service they provide.

Very Disappointed with Nike Customisation and Customer ServiceI customised a pair of Nike Air Force 1s on September 7th, with a delivery scheduled for September 27th. Initially, everything seemed fine—I received all the tracking details and updates from UPS. However, on the 27th, I got a notification saying my delivery had failed and that my order had been sent to a local mini-market for collection. I also received a text message asking me to bring my ID and reference number.Firstly, I have a Ring doorbell and Reolink CCTV around my property, and no delivery attempt was made. Secondly, when I went to the mini-market, they informed me that they never received my order. I immediately contacted Nike’s customer service. During my first call, I was told that my order had been returned to Nike and was scheduled for recycling. When I asked why it couldn’t simply be resent to me, I was informed that this was their process. I requested a call back from a manager to discuss the situation further, and I was told I would receive a call within 24-48 hours.A week passed, and I had received no phone call and no refund. I called customer service again, received another apology, and was told once more that a manager would call me back—again, that call never came.After all this frustration, I finally received my refund, but I never heard back from a manager. Overall, I am extremely disappointed with both the delivery process and the lack of follow-through from Nike’s customer service. I expected much better from a company of this calibre.

review_title: Reduced quality at a greater cost!
cust_review_text: I have bought several NFL jerseys over the years, always opting for the more expensive 'Limited' jerseys with stitched name and numbers. I did the same when I purchased a Vapor F.U.S.E. jersey, expecting the same quality as before. At the time of my purchase (from Fanatics), I was unaware that the name and number were heat sealed, rather than stitched, along with other details on the jersey that are of a lesser quality (and yet, the price was more!). Nobody should be expected to spend upwards of £300 for an ‘Elite’ jersey just for this detail. I will never buy another Nike NFL jersey until I am satisfied that an affordable version of the jersey with stitched name and number and added attention to quality is produced (just like I have bought before).

The girl (who was standing with a young male colleague) said (in a very sarcastic manner) “the size is on the label in the back of her bottoms” I said I know but she needs to check as she can’t see behind her” she laughed a little which I found very condescending…I then said “could you look please” she made a sarcastic remark and I then I had to say quite embarrassingly “she’s not my daughter and I don’t want to be pulling her bottoms down to check a label in the middle of this store!” She continued to be insensitive and after a few awkward looks she eventually looked. review_title: I’ve found myself writing this review…
cust_review_text: I’ve found myself writing this review due to a couple of recent interactions with the diabolical customer service at Nike UK. My first experience was with a parcel that I’d returned. At first they had told me it hadn’t arrived and to wait. On contacting customer service again a week later they were still adamant it hadn’t arrived back and to wait another week. I decided to track my parcel with my receipt only to find it had arrived. When I questioned customer service about this they then agreed it was back but the parcel was empty. They refused to refund me or to help with the so called missing items from the parcel. They also insisted the problem was mine and I had to contact Royal Mail. It was clear from my postage receipt that the weight of the parcel contained the returned items. I had to contact my credit card company and claim a refund on the returned items. The credit card company upheld my complaints against Nike. My second and latest experience with the UK customer service was just as rude and dismissive.  I have two fly knit bras that after only four weeks have become loose and misshapen. When enquiring as to what I should do the representative told me that they were very sorry and yes I could return them. How would I like to ship them and what was my address? I was talking to Nike USA by mistake and they told me I’d have to contact Nike UK. No problem or so I thought. I went over to Nike UK site and after 45 minutes wait I got nowhere with customer service. I was told they must be the wrong size and that it wasn’t a fault with the bra. Really how do they know that for sure when I’ve got two bras in the same size and now one is looser and baggier than the other?!I was told I  couldn’t return them after they’d been worn and washed So you can’t wear and wash something and if it develops a fault you’re stuck with it. Non existent customer service. Of all the items I’ve bought which is extensive and being a loyal customer I’d only had to contact customer service twice. I’m not a complainer and rarely use a customer service to complain about faults. On both occasions NIKE UK have failed me as a customer miserably. Sadly I will no longer purchasing from Nike. I expected more from such a large company. If you’re an American customer though you’re given the red carpet treatment. The disdain for the UK customer was as clear as to me as night and day. I wouldn’t risk buying anything else from Nike. It’s not cheap and I expected so much more.

Hi,Normally I’m happy with the way Nike resolves issues but in this case I feel like the customer service representatives and the in-Store representative need to get on the same page with returns and exchanges. I did the return at the store in which the online rep said once i bring it to the store the exchange will process.. WRONG!!! That’s is not what happened. I received a refund and I was told the store should have initiated the exchange. $50 purchase down the drain for the sneakers to be back to $110 and Nike reps say there is both they can do. YES I’m very much not happy.

review_title: Sent 4 items back in 1 box only refunded for 1 item and customer service team calling me a liar
cust_review_text: I recently made an order of a large number of items as I was given a 25% discount code for my birthday. I ended up returning for items out of a large order. The total of these items was roundabout £350.I waited a week and then found out that Nick had only credited me back for one pair of slides that were a total of £33 I called up customer services to tell them the error and they told me they were make an investigation and will be in touch with me. I waited over two weeks with no response so I called up again and was told the investigation had been completed and that my items have not been received therefore I will not be getting a credit note for the rest of the items When I asked the agent to speak to a manager they outright refused and just stay completely silent when I asked again they remain silent and I said what are my options here I have sent back the items they said you have not sent back the items and basically called me a liar . I am not sure what has changed with customer services but I spend a lot of money with them via the membership app and I was classified as a VIP member. I used to get great customer service from them. It seems like they have moved their customer agents from Ireland to an Eastern European country where they the tone is very, very rude. I’m actually not sure what else to do now so it looks like I have lost out on over £300 if anyone from Nike is reading this your move to Eastern European call centre approach is not working before I wrote this review. I read a number of other reviews which were very similar to this it looks like you are outright not looking after your customers anymore. It is very sad to see as I’m a huge fan of the products. Maybe the answer is just not to order online anymore.

Story in 3 parts from Poland.1. The buyingI tried to buy the product via their website. Tried, because both payment via google pay and payment by card was rejected (nothing wrong with both payment types as i've just used them slightly earlier and slightly after the attempt). Finally I've gone to the store and bought it there, but their cashier had to use their company phone so i could order the shoes.2. The wearing experienceI tried on these trainers in the shop, weren't perfect but figured they'll adjust eventually. Nope, I was never more wrong in my life. I wore them again the next day, was just wearing different type of socks. After 15 mins it felt as if i'm walking on pins (or stepped on legos). Figured I'll return them when I have time to do so.3. The returnI finally went to the store as I have about a week left before I'm eligible for a return (and a refund). Store is closed temporarily as they're having some kind of refurbishing inside. Can't return it to the store as I was instructed in the receipt (an hour wasted for the trip). Calling support line - occupied. Reached out via chat... whether they offshore their support line or use "AI" (not much of an Intelligence though), this was the single worst customer line experience ever. Ready-made answers with no room for discussion from their side or answers that do not really answer my questions. Proceeded with the flow where I would have to pay for the return and I'd be granted a coupon for their products (which I'm no longer interested in, given the lack of comfort I had wearing those trainers), whereas I'm only interested in a return with a charge back to my card. Finally, after another half an hour wasted I got the answer that I can try returning it in a different store, already jumping with joy given today's experience.

As far as buying trainers goes, Nike is usually my number one choice as they USED TO BE good at indicating what materials were used on the shoes. But now the website is absolute trash and just waffles on about the style of the shoe and where the inspiration came from (as if anyone even cares!) and then states  “mixed materials”, whatever that means, or doesn’t even mention what it’s made of at all. It’s infuriating! I want to buy shoes made from ethical fabrics (ie, no skins of innocent animals), which Nike used to make me feel confident in, but now it’s anyone’s guess.  Even their colleagues on the chat don’t fill you with confidence as they don’t give a clear answer.  Unlikely to shop with them in future after recent attempts to shop on their website.

Dear Nike Customer Service,DO BETTER!! I am writing to express my deep frustration and dissatisfaction with your online services. I have been a loyal member since 2017, and it is disheartening to encounter ongoing problems that hinder my ability to make purchases.This is not the first time I have faced these issues. review_title: No limit on the amount of shoes allowed to be purchased
cust_review_text: It's a damn shame I can't even order a pair of shoes within 24 hours of it coming out because clearly there is no limit to the amount of pairs allowed to be bought at one time.  I just learned about Stock X... so if you're not sitting at the computer waiting for the shoe to "drop" you're not getting a pair unless you're willing to pay at least $50 extra from what Nike was charging.  I wanted the Jordan Retro 4's in the white thunder.  I went on Nike.com the DAY they were released and not a pair in site.  But guess where they were being sold when I googled the shoe... Stock X!  Already listed when you know there's no possible way the seller has the shoes already.  That's probably the reason my sons shoes wont be here before school starts... because the world has turned into a "resell" shop.  Makes me not even want to buy nike at all any more.Why would Nike care?  As long as they're making their money on them, it doesn't concern them.  But when I have a 14 year old son who wears a 14 in men's, I'm now forced to pay more than DOUBLE what the shoe costs on Nike's website because money hungry people buy them all up to resell.

review_title: Worst customer service in the world!
cust_review_text: The issue that I have experienced was: I am writing to express my profound dissatisfaction with the customer service I have received from your company. As a long-time Nike customer, I am appalled by the unprofessional and substandard assistance provided by your support team. The following points outline the specific issues I have encountered, which I believe are entirely unacceptable for a company of Nike's stature:Lack of Proper English: Several of your customer service agents have demonstrated a poor command of the English language. This has resulted in miscommunications and an inability to effectively address my concerns. Clear and professional communication should be a basic requirement for any customer service representative.Chats Ended Prematurely: On multiple occasions, your agents have ended my chats without answering my questions or resolving my issues. This abrupt and discourteous behavior is extremely frustrating and indicative of a lack of proper training and customer care.Unwillingness to Help: There have been instances where the agents seemed entirely unwilling to assist me. Rather than providing solutions or attempting to understand my problem, they often deflected my questions and ended the conversation prematurely. This attitude is unacceptable and reflects poorly on Nike's commitment to customer satisfaction.Contradictory Information: I have been told by one advisor that the information I provided was incorrect, only to be informed by another advisor that it was indeed correct. This inconsistency is confusing and suggests a serious lack of internal communication and knowledge among your staff.Multiple Agents for One Issue: It took interactions with four different chat agents before my problem was even acknowledged, let alone addressed. This unnecessary repetition and lack of continuity are highly inefficient and frustrating for customers who simply want their issues resolved in a timely manner.Misleading Information Regarding Warranty Claims: The information provided to me regarding my warranty claim was confusing and often contradictory. This led to significant delays and additional frustration on my part. Accurate and clear information is essential for customers to understand and navigate warranty claims effectively.Lack of Basic Manners and Care: The majority of the agents I interacted with displayed a complete lack of basic manners and empathy. A courteous and caring attitude is fundamental to good customer service, and it is disappointing to see this lacking in your support team.In light of these issues, I urge Nike to seriously reconsider the training and standards applied to your customer service team. I expect a company of your reputation to prioritize customer satisfaction and provide professional, efficient, and courteous service. I hope to see immediate improvements in these areas and a resolution to my ongoing issue.

review_title: Not the best customer service :( I love…
cust_review_text: Not the best customer service :( I love this brand but they could do better, really.

Avis en FrançaisJe suis extrêmement déçu par mon expérience avec Nike. En juin, j'ai commandé une paire de chaussures qui ne me convenait pas. J'ai donc décidé de les retourner quelques jours après réception du colis, profitant de mon droit de retour. Nike m'a fourni un QR code pour le retour via Mondial Relay. Le responsable du point de livraison m'a indiqué une possible erreur sur l'étiquette retour, qui mentionnait un poids de colis de 0,01 kg. Il m'a suggéré de prendre une photo de l'étiquette, mais j'ai fait confiance à Nike et ai renvoyé le colis.Le 28 juin, Mondial Relay m'informe que le colis a bien été livré à destination. Cependant, je n'ai reçu aucune nouvelle de Nike. Après avoir contacté leur service client, j'ai été informé qu'un ticket avait été levé auprès d'une équipe senior. Dix jours plus tard, sans nouvelles, je les recontacte et on me dit que l'article reçu ne correspondait pas à l'article attendu. Ils refusent de me rembourser et mettent fin à la conversation sans plus d'explications. Je suspecte qu'ils se basent uniquement sur le poids du colis pour justifier leur décision.En attendant, j'ai perdu 195 euros, une paire de baskets s'est probablement perdue dans leurs entrepôts, et personne chez Nike ne semble vouloir en prendre la responsabilité. Service client inacceptable !Review in EnglishI am extremely disappointed with my experience with Nike. In June, I ordered a pair of shoes that I did not like. A few days after receiving the package, I decided to return them, taking advantage of my right to return. Nike provided me with a QR code for the return via Mondial Relay. The delivery point manager indicated a possible error on the return label, which mentioned a package weight of 0.01 kg. He suggested I take a photo of the label, but I trusted Nike and sent the package back.On June 28th, Mondial Relay informed me that the package had been delivered to its destination. However, I received no news from Nike. After contacting their customer service, I was told that a ticket had been raised with a senior team. Ten days later, without any news, I contacted them again and was told that the received item did not match the expected item. They refused to refund me and ended the conversation without further explanation. I suspect they are solely relying on the package weight to justify their decision.Meanwhile, I lost 195 euros, a pair of shoes is likely lost in their warehouses, and no one at Nike seems to want to take responsibility. Unacceptable customer service!

I will never be using Nike again disgusting customer service.

Unfortunately, after an accidental incident where someone stepped on my shoes, they got dirty. I purchased a foam cleaner from the same store, believing it would help clean them. This lack of availability to address customer concerns is highly disappointing and frustrating.As a loyal customer who has always trusted Nike for quality products, this experience has left me disillusioned. The inability to receive proper support when facing an issue with their product is unacceptable.I hope Nike can improve their customer service accessibility and responsiveness so that others do not encounter similar challenges in the future.

review_title: Completely incompetent and impossible to speak to.
cust_review_text: Completely incompetent and had to threaten them with a credit card chargeback to get anything done. Beware, despite being a billion dollar company, none of this is spent on customer service or logistics. I ordered the new England kit for my sons birthday and added a number and his name. Delivery was supposed to be in 7 days giving me a 1 day buffer. 2 days before it should have come I get an email saying it has been 'delayed'. Nothing more. Frantically I try to speak to a human being only to get bots and nonsense and finally when I do speak to someone they tell me, 'you need to wait', no explanation of what the problem is or a delivery update, just 'wait' and that 'we have no way to communicate with the warehouse'. The promised delivery date comes and goes with no change so I tell them I need to cancel as they've let me down and I get told I can't. Several hours of trying to speak to a person who has understands the situation is wasted before I threaten to do a credit card chargeback and they agree to cancel, telling me I'll get a confirmation by email (I record the chat transcript). The email never comes and I go out and buy my son the kit, on his birthday. A week and a half later I get confirmation my order is on its way. Cue another hour long chat with CS at which point they tell me I can send it back. I tell them if it comes they have a choice, give it to me for free or collect one evening on a day of my choice, if not there's going to be a chargeback. Amazing how they get their act together when it will cost them money. Given the circumstances any decent company would have apologised (they didn't) and just said keep the shirt for your trouble. Avoid like the plague.

Hi my name is Ryan,I have neurological disabilities and need my carer to accompany me when shopping.I purchased a size 8 flip flop and when returning home opened the box to find 1 shoe and it was a size 10!!My carer has other patients in the area to see that day so couldn’t return me to the store so due to my anxiety and stress regarding this situation I decided to take a taxi back on the day to resolve the matter where I was met with total stubbornness by the female member off staff and she basically said “oops sorry” but because I struggle with communication skills and mixing with people I just got my refund and returned home ASAP. I rang the store to complain and spoke to the manager Avesta who said he would deal with this situation and email me in the next hour.I never received an email an for 3 weeks couldn’t contact the store via the land line number on google.When I did reach Avesta he said he had miss wrote my email address and  could offer me 10% off my next purchase which I wasn’t happy with as I have been shopping with Nike for years and an ex athlete who suffered a brain injury. I Explained to him I feel let down and not taken seriously due to my illness people over look me and sometimes feel invisible.I asked him to escalate the matter with his seniors and see what they could do for me as I can’t make it into store after a series off seizures I recently taken into hospital.Unfortunately I wasn’t important enough for Nike to offer me any other alternative solutions to resolve my bad experience and he said that he had tried but it has came from his seniors.I am so disappointed in the way this world wide brand treat neurologically challenged ex athletes.Won’t be shopping with Nike. Until they make some changes for people who have non visible disabilities. :( Ryan-Leeds Roberts

For a company that is worth £123.9 billion using not only the cheapest courier but a thieving one that is damaging your reputation, stealing from your customers and stealing from your company should be enough to make the CEO/chairmen of Nike feel absolutely embarrassed. review_title: Extremely Disappointed with Nike's Service and Product Quality
cust_review_text: I am writing to express my utter dissatisfaction with my recent experience with Nike. On July 1st, 2023, I purchased a pair of LeBron 20 shoes, expecting the premium quality that Nike is reputed for. However, within just three months, a swollen bump appeared beneath the left shoe, which is something I have never experienced with any footwear before.Two months later, while playing indoor basketball, the bump punctured, causing an audible escape of air with every step. Given that the shoes were still within the manufacturing date, I sent them back to Nike for inspection, hoping for a fair resolution.To my dismay, I received a response stating, "We have received your claim product and after a thorough inspection, we've determined the issue with the Airbag is a result of contact with a sharp foreign object. This is not a material or manufacturing fault per our returns guidelines, and we're unable to issue a replacement product. We're returning your item to you."This is utterly unfair and unacceptable. I paid over $300 for these shoes, expecting durability and quality. Instead, I received a defective product that Nike refuses to take responsibility for. It is beyond disappointing to be blamed for a manufacturing flaw.I am boycotting Nike and will be sharing my negative experience with others. I have never spent so much on a pair of shoes, and this incident has taught me a valuable lesson. Nike's handling of this situation has been unprofessional and disheartening, and I will not be purchasing from your company again.

Sent them back via mail because the nearest store is almost two hours away and I thought this would be faster. That’s a hard NO. It’s been over a month and I just spoke via chat support about getting my refund. I saw that the exchange was canceled last week because it has now taken so long that his new size has sold out. The warehouse they were sent back to has horrible reviews and seems sketchy. I was not notified about my return or exchange being canceled. Most companies send your exchange after they’ve received the old return and this warehouse had my shoes for weeks. Moral of this, don’t guy directly from Nike or plan on wasting your gas to return in store. This company is joke!

review_title: Dear Nike, please stop using Evri
cust_review_text: I ordered a Travis Scott t-shirt using Nike's SNKRS service after waking up early to get it. It was dispatched to Evri for delivery, which they received on the 2nd of May. As of the 18th of May I have yet to receive it. On the 6th of May I called Nike to ask them if they are aware of where the parcel is, with the customer service caller telling me that the product was most likely stolen by the Evri warehouse workers. They had stated they had many cases of missing parcels with Evri and were looking into it, and therefore issued an immediate refund. While I appreciated the immediate refund and the services offered to facilitate this, this is not good enough. If as a company you are aware of your delivery provider potentially stealing the goods you sell, it should be in your best interests as well as the customers you claim to care about to immediately cut ties with them and work with another delivery provider in order to actually profit from the drop. Furthermore, there should be more stock of the goods sold kept behind in case of a situation such as this. Overall, I have no problem with Nike, but I absolutely have a problem with the choice of delivery provider. They have clearly chosen them due to how cheap the service is, but this comes at a great cost to your service, quality and reliability. I really want to buy the next Travis Scott shoe, but knowing my parcel would be at the mercy of Evri's warehouse workers I sense that it will end up as a pointless endeavour to no reward despite how sought after they are. Please never use Evri again!

review_title: I was disappointed by the poor service…
cust_review_text: I was disappointed by the poor service provided by Nike, a company I thought was reliable. Although I usually read reviews before ordering from lesser-known companies, I didn't think I needed to do so for Nike. I placed an order for two pairs of shoes through the official Nike app for a total of £168. The next day, I was provided with a tracking number, but it didn't show any delivery information or the delivery company responsible for my parcel. As time went by, I grew increasingly concerned and checked the app regularly for updates. However, I didn't receive any updates until I received an email stating that they had refunded my order without any explanation. When I contacted Nike, they informed me that the delivery company, DPD, had been unable to deliver my parcel - although I was at home the entire time and had received no attempted delivery notifications. I was disappointed as I had been looking forward to wearing these shoes to a special event. When I asked Nike to redeliver my order, they told me that I would have to place a new order and pay again. However, I had already lost trust in them, and I didn't want to risk experiencing the same issue again. I am currently waiting for my refund so that I can purchase shoes from another retailer.

Such a poor experience. Still awaiting refund for non delivery of goods.Order placed on 21/4/2024. I was informed it was dispatched 22/4 then informed of a problem on 23/4. Then nothing. I contacted dpd on 26/4 to be informed they’d lost my order and the d need to contact Nike for a refund. I did and was informed a refund had been raised back to my account. By 7/5 if still not received my refund so again contacted Nike. They confirmed it hadn’t been raised and again stated they would raise refund and it would be returned within 9 days. At this point no one from Nike or DpD has offered an apology for the non delivery and my poor experience. So I asked if gesture of goodwill would be appropriate given the failure to deliver and failure to process the refund. They offered a 10% code. I pointed out 10% bearly covered their delivery charge. Brick wall. I was then informed they don’t charge delivery IF you're a member. I explained I wasn’t, and given my experience AND no apology thought 10% was pretty poor, especially as I’d still not received a refund. The colleague said he had refunded it. I pointed out I’d been told this before and the refund had only been raised today because I had chased it. The Nike colleague was then rather aggressive and rude in their chat. I rejected to 10% as this isn’t a company I want to give future business to after this experience. I will update when/if my refund ever transpires. Which I will then happily spend on Adidas.

review_title: Disappointing Experience with Personalized England Kit from Nike
cust_review_text: I recently purchased a personalised England kit from Nike for my son, but the experience left much to be desired. Despite paying for personalisation, the order was delayed, and upon arrival, the box was severely damaged. Worse still, the personalisation on the football shirt was poorly done, with the letter 'A' partially missing from the wording.Upon contacting Nike to complain, I was met with a disappointing response. They offered the option to return the parcel, wait for it to be received, and then wait even longer for a full refund—hardly acceptable when my son needed the shirt for an upcoming event. Their alternative was a mere 20% discount, amounting to £14.00, issued as a voucher for future purchases on their website. This offer seemed paltry considering the £70 spent on the kit.What's more, the lack of empathy and understanding from the staff only exacerbated the situation. As a billion-dollar global brand, Nike should prioritize customer satisfaction, especially for everyday consumers who rely on their products. The absence of an apology or a proactive solution, such as collecting the defective kit, was truly disappointing.In conclusion, Nike's handling of this situation was nothing short of dcsisgraceful. For a company that sponsors celebrities and sports teams, they must do better by their regular customers, who cannot afford to endure such inconvenience and disappointment.

review_title: Gift card cannot use for full payment while online shopping

The system showed 'Sorry, we are unable to process your order. For more information, please call +44 (0) 2076604453 for help. [Code: 98D2586B ]'.I called 02076604453 by my phone.  However, the contact no. was changed.  (disappointed).Then, I live chatted with Nike.  The customer service told me '... and the reason why you are getting an error code is because you need to add payment method like Debit/Credit card as partial payment to fulfil the order.  This is known issue for Nike GC, we were unable to use one Nike GC to cover all the amount if we are placing an order at Nike.com or Nike app.'.  I was told 'we are not allowed to place an order for billing information security purposes.'.So. When you use Nike GC, don't full pay.

review_title: Do not buy NIKE gift cards
cust_review_text: Do not buy NIKE gift cards. We received four Nike $100 gift cards for Christmas that were purchased from Walgreens. These cards were printed with insufficient PIN numbers, per the NIKE outlet manager. The manager confirmed the balance, and said that we should call the 800 number and Nike would either re-issue the cards or provide an adequate PIN number in order to use the cards. Nike refused to honor gift cards and frauduantly zeroed the balance in order to do so. They said that the cards were used. This statement is inconsistent with the statement from the outlet manager, who said that the cards could not be used as issued, with only 4 numbers for the PIN. When pressed beyond the canned response about not being able to do anything for cards with a zero balance, they falsely reported that one of the cards was used at a store in the Bronx in December 2023. That was a fraudulent statement because the card was physically 1300 miles from there at that time. When I stated this inconsistency and asked for documentation of each card's alleged usage, they refused to disclose the information on the other two cards and would put nothing in writing. The customer service rep stated that I must go to local police and NIKE would provide information only if they received a subpeona.This dishonest business practice of refusing to honor gift cards by erasing the balance must be a standard operating procedure at Nike.

review_title: I recently visited the Nike Factory Store Manchester Fort
cust_review_text: I recently visited the Nike store in Manchester and, regrettably, my encounter with the manager, Avesta, left much to be desired. The service provided was cold and heartless, leading to a thoroughly disappointing experience.From the moment I stepped into the store, it was evident that customer satisfaction was not a priority. Avesta, the manager on duty, displayed a lack of empathy and failed to address my concerns adequately, leaving me feeling unheard and unappreciated as a customer.The overall atmosphere in the store felt tense, and it was disheartening to experience such a lack of professionalism from someone in a managerial position. Avesta's approach to customer service fell far short of the standards I expect from a brand as reputable as Nike.I believe that providing constructive feedback is crucial for improvement. I sincerely hope that Nike takes steps to address these issues, ensuring a more positive experience for future customers. Nike has a well-deserved reputation for excellence, and my encounter with Avesta was a disappointing departure from that expectation.I encourage Nike to invest in customer service training and create a more welcoming environment for patrons. As a loyal customer, I hope to witness positive changes in the service provided at this location in the future.This feedback is shared with the intention of contributing to the improvement of customer experiences at Nike, and I trust that steps will be taken to rectify these concerns.

I want to make this clear it is purely about the experience today with the website and phone support. Tried to purchase 2 pairs of shoes, at checkout I ended up getting all sorts of errors, despite choosing different payment methods (paypal, google pay) - the error did have a phone number which was actually a smart thing to include. Getting through to an operator was less than an easy task. I understand the more info you have, the speedier you get the operator to help us and more efficient your support is, but having a robot trying to "note down" my name, was anything but a easy task. In the end, I gave up and used John Smith. After that, I was quite fast speaking to Radha in India, who was polite and knowledgeable, but unfortunately, I could barely hear word and had to ask her to repeat herself countless times. Please improve the experience. Furthermore, the solution was to install the app or wait 24 hours, which I was reluctant to do, but in the end, turned out to be quite an easy option, but alas, on install the app forces you to offer marketing information, which is another downside. In fairness, I was pleasantly surprised the checkout was still filled from the website to the app based on my username, so that was what made this a 3 star rather than a 2.

review_title: You may never receive your order
cust_review_text: They use couriers that don't deliver items to doors. I bought an item online (€169 retail value). DPD were Nike.com's chosen courier. The courier left the parcel at the gate, on a main road, in full view of everyone passing by, and so open to theft, which does happen, as confirmed by a local postwoman. For this reason, I would not order from Nike.com online again. I raised the issue with DPD by email and never received a reply. I just called Nike customer service and there wasn't an option to escalate this to someone in a position to prevent it happening to other customers. In short; if you order from Nike.com, you are at risk of not receiving your parcel because their chosen courier will leave the parcel in an exposed location at high risk of theft, as opposed to delivering to a door like they're supposed to. High value items should require a signature on delivery.

review_title: App is brilliant but customer service…
cust_review_text: App is brilliant but customer service is awful

The returns process is abysmal. Almost like its been designed to be clunky so that you miss the return date.First, if you have multiple items from a single order, these have to be returned separately. There's no way to bundle them into a single return. Even though Nike ask "please use the original packaging iof possible". But you can't because if you return 2 of 3 items you bought, then each item has to be returned as a separate item, a separate return reference and a separate parcel.When they say 'Collect+" what they really mean is "Yodel".. You search for your "Collect+ drop off location", and when you get there, they refuse the parcel because there is a tiny marker on the bottom saying "Yodel"..Why they don't just have a link to 'Search for your Yodel drop off" I don't know.. As I said, likely so that you waste your time returning parcels to a Collect+ drop off point that doesn't accept Yodel.It's 2024, Internet shopping has been around for decades, yet Nike seem to have systems that were designed in 1997.. For a multi (hundreds of)-billion $ company it's very poor
